items.author: Roger Ebert
items.content: Spacey, an actor who embodies intelligence in his eyes and voice, is the right choice for Lester Burnham.

items.author: Christopher Brandon
items.content: A dark comical masterpiece that single-handedly announces the collapse of the American family infrastructure as it exists on the brink of Y2K.

items.author: Bill Gallo
items.content: It gracefully defies the usual categories, gets under your skin in ways you cannot anticipate, then works its way straight toward the heart. It's far and away the bravest and best movie of the year.

items.author: Peter Brunette
items.content: Hilarious, slightly sick, and super-edgy ...the acting of its two principals, Annette Bening and Kevin Spacey, is so sublime that it's worth seeing on that grounds alone.

items.author: Shawn Levy
items.content: Though excellent in many ways, American Beauty is, finally, an uneasy mix of assured technique and simplistic satire.

items.author: Richard Schickel
items.content: Kevin Spacey (gives) a truly great performance.

items.author: Ella Taylor
items.content: Surprises you with a kind of hardheaded romanticism.

items.author: David Sterritt
items.content: A ruthless dissection of suburban malaise.

items.author: Wesley Morris
items.content: A satire whose dead aim stops wounding - and starts making - stereotypes of white middle-classness.
